column4: how do i find out my network device's name? (I tried eth0, but it isn't it).
run ifconfig and it should show you a list
cool. so i did that. now which one in that list is the active one?
http://pastebin.ca/949360 <--ifconfig output. I can't figure out which is the device i'm using
i'm trying to do something like "sudo ifdown eth0 && sudo ifup eth0" to avoid my DNS Server settings being revoked after a reboot. (https://www.opendns.com/start?device=ubuntu#step1)
ath0.  It's the only one that has an IP that isn't 127.0.0.1
unop, thanks. but why then are "/dev/sda" and "dev/sda1" in the dropdown list for "device for boot loader installation"?
